cscd210Methods

Class CSCD210Lab18Methods

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd210Methods.CSCD210Lab18Methods

  • public class CSCD210Lab18Methods
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that contains the helper methods for the Letter and Address. All parameters will be final and all preconditions will be enforced

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CSCD210Lab18Methods()
      Don't write this constructor it is free

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Letter[] addLetter(Letter[] myLetters, java.lang.String toName, Address toAddress)
      The addLetter method adds a letter into the last element of a new array after copying the elements from the array passed in.
      static Address createAddress(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The createAddress method prompts the user to enter the city, street, full state name, and zipcode of the new letter.
      static Letter[] createAndFillArray(int total, java.util.Scanner fin)
      This method creates an array of Letters and then fills that array with Letter objects by reading from the file and creating a letter
      static int menu(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The menu method ensures a number in the range of the menu choices below
      1) Print all Letters to the screen
      2) Add a new letter to the array
      3) Organize the letters based on zip
      4) Organize the letters based on the to name
      5) Quit
      static java.lang.String readName(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The readName method reads the name of a new letter recipient

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • CSCD210Lab18Methods

        public CSCD210Lab18Methods()
        Don't write this constructor it is free

    • Method Detail

      • createAndFillArray

        public static Letter[] createAndFillArray(int total,
                                          java.util.Scanner fin)
        This method creates an array of Letters and then fills that array with Letter objects by reading from the file and creating a letter
        Parameters:
        total - Representing the total number of soon to be letters in the file
        fin - Representing the scanner object to the open file
        Returns:
        Letter [] Representing a filled array of Letters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if total < 1 or fin is null

      • menu

        public static int menu(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The menu method ensures a number in the range of the menu choices below
        1) Print all Letters to the screen
        2) Add a new letter to the array
        3) Organize the letters based on zip
        4) Organize the letters based on the to name
        5) Quit
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        int Representing the menu choice
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
        POSTCONDITION:
        The method ensures the input buffer is empty

      • addLetter

        public static Letter[] addLetter(Letter[] myLetters,
                                 java.lang.String toName,
                                 Address toAddress)
        The addLetter method adds a letter into the last element of a new array after copying the elements from the array passed in.
        Parameters:
        myLetters - The original array to copy the letters from
        toName - The name of the new letter recipient
        toAddress - The address of the new letter as an Address object
        Returns:
        Letter [] The new array with the new letter in the last element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if myLetters is null, toName is null or empty and toAddress is null

      • createAddress

        public static Address createAddress(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The createAddress method prompts the user to enter the city, street, full state name, and zipcode of the new letter.
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        Address Representing the new Address object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
        POSTCONDITION:
        The method ensures the input buffer is empty

      • readName

        public static java.lang.String readName(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readName method reads the name of a new letter recipient
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        String Representing the name of the new letter recipient
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
        POSTCONDITION:
        The method ensures the input buffer is empty
